com.mellanox.jxio

Class ServerPortal

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mellanox.jxio.ServerPortal

  • public class ServerPortal
extends java.lang.Object
    ServerPortal is the object which listens to incoming connections. He can accept/reject or forward to another portal the new session request. There are two kinds of ServerPortal: 1. listener - listens on a well known port and redirects the session to a different thread (he can also accept the session) 2. worker - sessions are redirected to him. The requests from Client will arrive on this portal ServerPortal receives several events on his lifetime. On each of them a method of interface Callbacks is invoked. User must implement this interface and pass it in c-tor. The events are: 1. onSessionNew. 2. onSessionEvent.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServerPortal

        public ServerPortal(EventQueueHandler eventQHandler,
            java.net.URI uri,
            ServerPortal.Callbacks callbacks)
        This constructor is for the ServerPortal listener. He istens on a well known port and redirects the request for a new session to ServerPortal worker
        Parameters:
        eventQHandler - - EventQueueHAndler on which the events (onSessionNew, onSessionEvent etc) of this portal will arrive
        uri - - on which the ServerPortal will listen. Should contain a well known port
        callbacks - - implementation of Interface ServerPortal.Callbacks

      • ServerPortal

        public ServerPortal(EventQueueHandler eventQHandler,
            java.net.URI uri)
        This constructor is for the ServerPortal worker. A new session is redirected here by ServerPortal listener
        Parameters:
        eventQHandler - - EventQueueHandler on which events of the session will arrive
        uri - - Should be uri for listener from ServerPortal listener; listener.getUriForServer()

    • Method Detail

      • getUriForServer

        public java.net.URI getUriForServer()
        Returns URI for ServerPortal listener. This method is called from ServerPortal listener
        Returns:
        URI for ServerPortal listener

      • close

        public boolean close()
        This method closes the ServerPortal. The method is asynchronous: the ServerPortal will be closed only when it receives event POTRTAL_CLOSED. If there are still ServerSessions on this ServerPortal, they will be closed as well. Only after SESSION_CLOSED will be recieved on all ServerSessions (if there are any), SERVER_PORTAL event will be received/.
        Returns:
        true if there was a successful call to close of the ServerPortal object on C side and false otherwise

      • accept

        public void accept(ServerSession serverSession)
        This method accepts the serverSession on this ServerPortal. This means that all ServerSession events will arrive on this ServerPortal's EventQueueHandler.
        Parameters:
        serverSession - to accept

      • forward

        public void forward(ServerPortal portal,
           ServerSession serverSession)
        This method forwards the serverSession on the ServerPortal. This means that all ServerSession events will arrive on this portal's EventQueueHandler.
        Parameters:
        portal -
        serverSession -

      • reject

        public void reject(ServerSession.SessionKey sesKey,
          EventReason reason,
          java.lang.String data)
        This method rejects the Session.
        Parameters:
        sesKey - which was received in callback onNewSession
        reason - - reason to reject the Session
        data - - data to pass to the client
